title: Chinese Pork and Buk Choi
ingredients:
1 container of char siu or roast pork
(itâ€™s already cut up into pieces ready to eat)
1 or 2 buk choi (Chinese cabbage)
1/2 tsp crushed garlic
1/2 tsp crushed ginger
1 tbspn peanut oil
1 dstspn corn flour mixed to a paste with water
Oyster or soya sauce
method: Wash the buk choi well, drain and then cut into bite size pieces.

Add peanut oil to a large saucepan or wok, and when very hot, toss in the cabbage, garlic and ginger and stir fry quickly for a few minutes, then add the pork and keep tossing, finishing off by adding half a cup of water and the cornflour paste.
Add oyster or soy sauce to taste.
Serve with some plain steamed rice (a rice cooker or microwave is an easy way to prepare plain rice).
I always wash the rice first to remove excess starch.
I think a stir-fry dish always is improved by sprinkling on some finely chopped spring onions just before serving.
